fields.name: encoding sample rate
fields.comment:
This can be used to resample the sample rate to be different from the source sample rate.
Choosing "automatic" will, instead, do the default behavior of picking the closer sample rate to the highest sample rate of all of the permutations.

fields.name: encoding channel count
fields.comment:
This can be used to mix up/down the channel count to be different from the source channel count.
Choosing "automatic" will, instead, do the default behavior of picking the highest channel count of all of the permutations.

fields.name: encoding format
fields.comment: Format to use when generating the tag

fields.name: compression level
fields.comment:
This can be from 0.0 to 1.0.
For Ogg Vorbis, higher levels meaning better quality but worse sizes (quality 0 to quality 10).
For FLAC, this is the inverse: higher levels mean better sizes but longer compression times, and this is clamped to 0.0 to 0.8 (FLAC 0 to FLAC 8).
Note that higher Ogg Vorbis levels will be worse than FLAC 8 in both size and quality.

fields.name: compression bitrate
fields.comment: If "use constant bitrate when possible" is set, then compression level will be disregarded when using a lossy compression, and this constant bitrate will be used instead.

fields.name: source FLACs
fields.comment: This is a collection of all of the source audio used for each actual permutation, re-encoded as FLAC
